title: Trump says Covid-19 is reduced to 'ashes.' Data doesn't
Dow plummets over 1,800 points
description: The stocks mega-rally hit a roadblock: A somber economic outlook from the US Federal Reserve and the 2 millionth coronavirus case in the United States has investors questioning whether they had boosted the stock market too far, too fast.

title: White House task force continues retreat even as virus reemerges
description: Coronavirus spikes in more than a dozen US states since Memorial Day haven't prompted President Donald Trump to revert to the "wartime" stance he once attempted at the height of the pandemic.

title: Moderna expects to begin phase 3 vaccine trial soon
Volkswagen made a racist ad. Here's why no one got fired
description: Volkswagen on Thursday blamed a "lack of sensitivity and procedural errors" for its failure to prevent the creation and publication of a racist video but resisted calls to fire those responsible.

title: America's top general apologizes for appearing in photo-op with Trump
description: America's top general is apologizing for appearing in a photo-op with President Donald Trump after the forceful dispersal of protesters outside the White House last week, saying the move was a "mistake."

title: GOP-led Senate panel authorizes subpoenas of top Obama officials
description: Director of National Intelligence John Ratcliffe declassified more documents Thursday and a Senate panel approved a wide-ranging authorization to subpoena former Obama administration officials as Republicans ratcheted up their efforts to scrutinize the origins of the FBI's investigation into Russia and President Donald Trump's team.

title: Sajid Javid: Racism wasn't born on the streets of America
description: Former UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Sajid Javid says the death of George Floyd has rightly provoked soul searching in the UK too and the government must act to tackle racism

title: The Tamagotchi virtual pet from the 90s is back
description: The Tamagotchi is back.

title: It looks like a photo, but it's a drawing
description: You're not alone if you do a double-take when you see one of Arinze Stanley's drawings—his portraits are so lifelike, they are often mistaken for photographs.

title: Trump's press secretary claims Juneteenth is 'meaningful' to him. Others see a racist play
description:
• Analysis: Why Trump's rally will be a disaster
• Opinion: Time for Pence to jump ship?

title: Trump tries to stop probe of potential US war crimes by authorizing sanctions against ICC
description: President Donald Trump on Thursday authorized sanctions and additional visa restrictions against International Criminal Court personnel -- the latest attempt by the administration to strong-arm the international body out of an investigation into a potential war crimes by US military and intelligence officials.

title: Trans activists call J.K. Rowling essay 'devastating'
description: Stars of the "Harry Potter" movie franchise have joined trans activists in standing with the transgender community after the publication of a lengthy essay by author J.K Rowling.

title: Two London police officers attacked in 'shocking' incident
description: Two London police officers have been attacked in an incident caught on film by members of the public, sparking condemnation from the UK's Home Secretary and the city's mayor.

title: Brianna Keilar: You are watching America's reckoning
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar outlines some major cultural shifts the US is seeing in the wake of the death of George Floyd while in Minneapolis police custody.

title: Trump says Covid-19 reduced to 'ashes'. Data doesn't
description: President Donald Trump is getting what he wants: The country is opening up come what may, despite alarming indications that the coronavirus pandemic is intensifying its assault.

title: See CNN's debut Electoral College map for the 2020 race
White people are already experts on racism
description: When I knew him in the mid-1990s, Nick (as I'll call him here) bore a disconcerting resemblance to Dickie Greenleaf, the character played by Jude Law in "The Talented Mr. Ripley." He came from a wealthy New England family on Boston's North Shore; he'd been expelled from a dozen prep schools and barely graduated from college; he was effortlessly good at all sports and was the center of attention wherever he went.

title: Mnuchin: 'We can't shut down the economy again'
description: Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said Thursday that the US economy will not be shut down again, despite a continued rise in coronavirus cases -- more than 2 million in the US -- and a key model projecting a steep increase this fall.

title: Model reveals racist and transphobic abuse she's received since L'Oreal appointment
description: British model Munroe Bergdorf has said her social media messages have been "flooded" by racist and transphobic abuse since she announced she will join L'Oreal's UK diversity board.

title: Banksy artwork stolen from Paris' Bataclan theater is found in Italy
description: Italian police have found a Banksy artwork that was stolen from outside the Bataclan theater in Paris last year.

title: Ex-NFL star 'honors' Matthew McConaughey for fronting up to talk about race
description: "How can I do better as white man," actor Matthew McConaughey recently asked Emmanuel Acho as part of the former NFL star's YouTube series "Uncomfortable Conversations with a Black Man."

title: Rescuers rush to sinking boat with nine people aboard
description: Rescuers saved nine people when a boat started to sink off the Florida coast.

title: 'We're forgotten': Mexico City paramedics say the government isn't getting their backs
Even Queen Elizabeth is Zooming
description: Queen Elizabeth II has made a video conferencing call as part of her royal duties for the first time ever.

title: 'Catastrophic' one-two punch from coronavirus and Brexit threatens UK
description: Britain is already heading for the worst coronavirus-induced slump of any major economy. Now fears are rising that businesses could be slammed by a second body blow this year — the failure of trade talks with the European Union.

title: Maldives lifts all restrictions for visitors
description: The Maldives is reopening to all visitors next month with no restrictions.

title: 'Enigmatic' footprints reveal prehistoric crocodile that walked on two legs
description: Ancient footprints embedded in rock in South Korea likely belonged to a prehistoric crocodile that walked on two legs. It's the first time this gait has been found in this family of ancient crocs, which typically walked on four legs like modern-day crocodiles and alligators.

title: Biden 'absolutely convinced' military would escort Trump from White House if he loses and refuses to leave
description: Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden said Wednesday he is "absolutely convinced" the military would escort President Donald Trump from the White House if he loses the election but refuses to leave office.

title: Restaurant owners given 723 years in prison for seafood scam
description: Two restaurant owners have been sentenced to 723 years in prison in Thailand, after defrauding the public with a seafood promotion.

title: Ex-officer charged in George Floyd's death is released on bond
description: One of the four former Minneapolis police officers awaiting trial in the death of George Floyd has been released on $750,000 bond.

title: Statue of Scouts founder to be removed. Who is Robert Baden-Powell and why is he controversial?
description: A statue of Scouts founder Robert Baden-Powell will be removed from a quayside in Dorset, southern England, as the UK continues to reckon with monuments of its imperialist past.

title: Rights group says Zoom shut down its account after Tiananmen Square anniversary event
description: A US-based group supporting human rights in China says it is "outraged" that the video conferencing company Zoom temporarily shut down its account after it held an event on the platform in remembrance of the Tiananmen Square massacre.

title: German prosecutors say they have new evidence in Madeleine McCann case, but not enough
description: German prosecutors have said they have evidence that a man jailed for another crime killed British toddler Madeleine McCann 13 years ago -- just not enough to charge the suspect in court.

title: Pence tweets, then deletes, photo of campaign staff
description: Vice President Mike Pence tweeted a photo showing a crowd of President Donald Trump's reelection campaign staff not wearing face masks or social distancing. The photo appeared to be from the campaign's Arlington, Virginia, office. Pence later deleted the tweet.

title: IOC pledges to work with athletes on relaxing Olympic protest policy
description: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) is consulting the organization's Athletes' Commission before deciding whether to relax its stance against protests.

title: 13-0: The scoreline that shook the 2019 Women's World Cup
description: One year ago, when the final whistle blew in Stade Auguste-Delaune in France the scoreline sent shockwaves around the world: 13 goals to the US Women's National Team, none to Thailand.

title: There's no pause button for these 3 security threats in the US
description: When the United States emerges from the Covid-19 public health crisis, its national security will need time to recover before operating at full strength again.

title: Expats buy Japanese country house for a song and get way more than they bargained for
description: Kimberly and Paul Fradale were living in Tokyo, working at international schools, when they took the leap many an American expat dreams of: buying a large country house for a song and restoring it to its former glory.

title: Can this super-simple device stop virus spreading on airplanes?
description: It's not flashy or futuristic-looking, but it's simple, cheap and apparently effective: British aircraft interior company RAS Completions says its new personal protection shield could help protect fliers from Covid-19.

title: India's richest city should have been its most prepared for coronavirus. So why does Mumbai have the country's highest infection rate?
description: India's richest city is buckling under the weight of the coronavirus crisis.

title: Japan's richest man: The very image of America is breaking
description: Tears in America's social fabric are having a devastating impact on retail business, according to Japan's richest man, Tadashi Yanai. The CEO of Fast Retailing, which owns Uniqlo, said his business reopened after the Covid-19 shutdown, but protests in the US have doubled the economic pain. Journalist Kaori Enjoji reports.

title: 'Revenge spending' in China is giving luxury brands some hope
description: Chinese shoppers are finally starting to snap up high-end handbags, shoes and jewelry again, giving the luxury goods industry hope that a recovery from the coronavirus pandemic is on the way.

title: Architects have designed a Martian city for the desert outside Dubai
description: Dubai is a city where firefighters use jetpacks, archipelagos are built from scratch, and buildings climb into the clouds; a slick metropolis in the middle of a vast red desert. First-time visitors would be forgiven for thinking they had stumbled onto a film set for a sci-fi movie.

title: Hear stunning question investor asked this black entrepreneur
description: Racial bias in the US can impact every aspect of life for a person of color, including their ability to start a business. CNN's Clare Sebastian reports.
